textgoal: Let expressions allow us to assign values to variables, and use it in later code blocks.
Choose the number that makes this expression equal to 4.
Define a function that swaps the key and value of a pair
Functions can also be assigned as a variable name using let.

board: ['[["Lebron James", [25, 20, 28]], ["Anthony Davis", [34, 32, 31]], ["Kyle Kuzuma", [8, 23, 17]], ["JaVale McGee", [10, 15, 14]], ["Danny Green", [11, 14, 19]]]', 'function gamePoints(list, gameIndex) {return helper = ((headItem) => (tailValue) => _) in (reduce(_,list));}', 'gameIndex', 'helper', 'get(getValue(headItem), _) + tailValue']
textgoal: Remember summing up the points for different games? Let's try to write a generalized the function!

board: ['[["Lebron James", [25, 20, 28]], ["Anthony Davis", [34, 32, 31]], ["Kyle Kuzuma", [8, 23, 17]], ["JaVale McGee", [10, 15, 14]], ["Danny Green", [11, 14, 19]]]', 'function gamePoints(list, gameIndex) {return helper = ((headItem) => (tailValue) => _) in (_);}', 'gameIndex', 'helper', 'get(_, _) + _', 'getValue', 'headItem', 'tailValue', 'reduce', 'list']
